definition: auspicious/propitious/good fortune
lucky/giga- (meaning billion or 10^9)
surname Ji/abbr. for Jilin Province 吉林省[Ji2 lin2 Sheng3]
to celebrate

sentences.english: But remember this auspicious month comes but once a year.
sentences.chinese: 但要記得，吉慶的齋月，每年只有一次。

sentences.english: Be happy and constantly remind yourself of the blessings in your life.
sentences.chinese: 要幸福快樂，不斷以生活中的吉慶提醒自己。

sentences.english: If you want to acquire the possession of both worlds.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想要同時獲得兩世的吉慶美好。

sentences.english: The sprawling campus is pleasant enough but badly dilapidated.
sentences.chinese: 現在校園裏洋溢着吉慶，但面貌仍是極度破敗。

sentences.english: May Allah reward you and grant you forgiveness in this blessed month.
sentences.chinese: 願安拉獎賞你，在這個尊貴吉慶的齋月寬恕你。

sentences.english: We fast also to honor the Revelation of the Qur'an in this blessed month.
sentences.chinese: 我們齋戒同樣尊重在這個吉慶月份中古蘭經的降世。

definition: abundant harvest of all food crops/bumper grain harvest
to accept a life of ease/to enjoy a comfortable retirement
to arrive home/facing one's home/home-coming/(soccer) facing the goalmouth
prosperous year/year with bumper harvest
lit. (may you) have abundance year after year/(an auspicious saying for the Lunar New Year)
May you have peace year after year (New Year's greeting)
Happy New Year
(in the spring) nature takes on a new look (idiom)
eye-opening ceremony for a religious idol (Buddhism)/to consecrate/to bless/transparent/translucent/haircut/shaving the head or face (humorous)/a method of decoration/first light (astronomy)
start of the year
display of fireworks and lanterns
Year 10, year of the Cock (e.g. 2005)
Tai Sui, God of the year/archaic name for the planet Jupiter 木星[Mu4 xing1]/nickname for sb who is the most powerful in an area
joss stick and candle
the country prospers, the people at peace (idiom); peace and prosperity
to bless and protect/to protect
